intro: Kohautia subverticillata subsp. eritreensis, commonly known as the Eritrean kohautia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Eritrea. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are basal, pinnately divided, and often have a distinctive silvery or greyish underside. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
